p: By contrast, the reasons for the absence of this species in Korea and Japan are different from those in southeast China. The location of LGM refugia can impact the post-LGM colonization of species ( Firbas, 1949), principally by affecting the expansion of species to current climatically suitable areas ( Normand et al., 2011). The absence of glacial refugia in Korea and Japan led to the lack of a resource population for expansion. At the same time, the limited long-distance dispersal ability of P. amabilis and separation by climatically unsuitable areas and the ocean resulted in the impossibility of colonization from the refugia in southeast China. Consequently, the failure of post-LGM colonization led to the absence of living P. amabilis in Korea and Japan, despite a suitable climate in those regions.
